metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34475 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description: SVG <use> tags that referenced a same-origin document could have resulted in script execution if attacker input was sanitized via the HTML Sanitizer API. This would have required the attacker to reference a same-origin JavaScript file containing the script to be executed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 102. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34475` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1 No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
